force:apex:execute.description:
executes anonymous Apex code
Executes one or more lines of anonymous Apex code entered on the command line, or executes the code in a local file.
If you don’t run this command from within a Salesforce DX project, —-targetusername is required.
To execute your code interactively, run this command with no parameters. At the prompt, enter all your Apex code; press CTRL-D when you're finished. Your code is then executed in a single execute anonymous request.
For more information, see "Anonymous Blocks" in the Apex Developer Guide.
examples:
$ sfdx force:apex:execute 
Start typing Apex code. Press the Enter key after each line, then press CTRL+D when finished.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

apexcodefile.name: apexcodefile
apexcodefile.description: path to a local file that contains Apex code

force:apex:execute.longDescription:
Executes one or more lines of anonymous Apex code entered on the command line, or executes the code in a local file.
If you don’t run this command from within a Salesforce DX project, —-targetusername is required.
To execute your code interactively, run this command with no parameters. At the prompt, enter all your Apex code; press CTRL-D when you're finished. Your code is then executed in a single execute anonymous request.
For more information, see "Anonymous Blocks" in the Apex Developer Guide.

apexcodefile.description: path to a local file that contains Apex code

loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation
loglevel.longDescription: The logging level for this command invocation. Logs are stored in $HOME/.sfdx/sfdx.log.

apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command
apiversion.longDescription: Override the API version used for API requests made by this command.

force:apex:log:get.description:
fetch debug logs
Fetches the specified log or given number of most recent logs from the scratch org. 
To get the IDs for your debug logs, run "sfdx force:apex:log:list". 
Use the --logid parameter to return a specific log. 
Use the --number parameter to return the specified number of recent logs.
Use the --outputdir parameter to specify the directory to store the logs in.
Executing this command without parameters returns the most recent log.

loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

logid.name: logid
logid.description: id of the log to display

number.name: number
number.description: number of most recent logs to display

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: directory for saving the log files

force:apex:log:get.longDescription:
Fetches the specified log or given number of most recent logs from the scratch org. 
To get the IDs for your debug logs, run "sfdx force:apex:log:list". 
Use the --logid parameter to return a specific log. 
Use the --number parameter to return the specified number of recent logs.
Use the --outputdir parameter to specify the directory to store the logs in.
Executing this command without parameters returns the most recent log.

logid.description: id of the log to display

number.description: number of most recent logs to display

outputdir.description: directory for saving the log files
outputdir.longDescription: The location can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory. The default is the current directory.

force:apex:log:list.description:
display a list of IDs and general information about debug logs
Run this command in a project to list the IDs and general information for all debug logs in your default org.
To fetch a specific log from your org, obtain the ID from this command's output, then run the “sfdx force:apex:log:get” command.

Run this command in a project to list the IDs and general information for all debug logs in your default org.
To fetch a specific log from your org, obtain the ID from this command's output, then run the “sfdx force:apex:log:get” command.

force:apex:log:tail.description:
Follows active log
Activates debug logging and displays logs in the terminal. You can also pipe the logs to a file.

color.description: Applies default colors to noteworthy log lines.

debuglevel.name: debuglevel
debuglevel.description: Debug level to set on the DEVELOPER_LOG trace flag for your user.

skiptraceflag.name: skiptraceflag
skiptraceflag.description: Skips trace flag setup. Assumes that a trace flag and debug level are fully set up.

force:apex:test:report.description:
display test results for a specific asynchronous test run
Provide a test run ID to display test results for an enqueued or completed asynchronous test run. The test run ID is displayed after running the "sfdx force:apex:test:run" command.
examples: $ sfdx force:apex:test:report -i <test run id> -c -d <path to outputdir> -u me@myorg

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: [default: warn] logging level for this command invocation; logs are stored in $HOME/.sfdx/sfdx.log

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

testrunid.name: testrunid
testrunid.description: the ID of the test run

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: directory to store test result files

resultformat.name: resultformat
resultformat.description: Permissible values are: human, tap, junit, json

wait.name: wait
wait.description: sets the streaming client socket timeout in minutes; specify a longer wait time if timeouts occur frequently

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: display Apex test processing details; if JSON is specified, processing details aren't displayed

force:apex:test:report.longDescription: Provide a test run ID to display test results for an enqueued or completed asynchronous test run. The test run ID is displayed after running the "sfdx force:apex:test:run" command.

testrunid.description: the ID of the test run

loglevel.description: [default: warn] logging level for this command invocation; logs are stored in $HOME/.sfdx/sfdx.log
loglevel.longDescription: Permissible values are: trace, debug, info, warn, error, fatal, TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL

apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command
apiversion.longDescription: Override the API version used for API requests made by this command.

outputdir.description: directory to store test result files

resultformat.description: Permissible values are: human, tap, junit, json

wait.description: sets the streaming client socket timeout in minutes; specify a longer wait time if timeouts occur frequently

verbose.description: display Apex test processing details; if JSON is specified, processing details aren't displayed
verbose.longDescription: Emit additional command output to stdout.

force:apex:test:run.description:
invoke Apex tests
Specify which tests to run by using the --classnames, --suites, or --tests parameters. Alternatively, use the --testlevel parameter to run all the tests in your org, local tests, or specified tests.
To see code coverage results, use the --codecoverage parameter with --resultformat. The output displays a high-level summary of the test run and the code coverage values for classes in your org. If you specify human-readable result format, use the --detailedcoverage parameter to see detailed coverage results for each test method run.

NOTE: The testRunCoverage value (JSON and JUnit result formats) is a percentage of the covered lines and total lines from all the Apex classes evaluated by the tests in this run.
examples: $ sfdx force:apex:test:run -l RunLocalTests -d <path to outputdir> -u me@my.org

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: [default: warn] logging level for this command invocation; logs are stored in $HOME/.sfdx/sfdx.log

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

outputdir.name: outputdir
outputdir.description: directory to store test run files

testlevel.name: testlevel
testlevel.description:
specifies which tests to run, using one of these TestLevel enum values:
RunSpecifiedTests—Only the tests that you specify are run.
RunLocalTests—All tests in your org are run, except the ones that originate from installed managed packages.
RunAllTestsInOrg—All tests are in your org and in installed managed packages are run

classnames.name: classnames
classnames.description: comma-separated list of Apex test class names to run; if you select --classnames, you can't specify --suitenames or --tests

resultformat.name: resultformat
resultformat.description: Permissible values are: human, tap, junit, json

suitenames.name: suitenames
suitenames.description: comma-separated list of Apex test suite names to run; if you select --suitenames, you can't specify --classnames or --tests

tests.name: tests
tests.description: comma-separated list of Apex test class names or IDs and, if applicable, test methods to run; if you specify --tests, you can't specify --classnames or --suitenames

wait.name: wait
wait.description: sets the streaming client socket timeout in minutes; specify a longer wait time if timeouts occur frequently

synchronous.name: synchronous
synchronous.description: runs test methods from a single Apex class synchronously; if not specified, tests are run ansynchronously

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: display Apex test processing details; if JSON is specified, processing details aren't displayed

detailedcoverage.name: detailedcoverage
detailedcoverage.description: display detailed code coverage per test

force:apex:test:run.longDescription:
Specify which tests to run by using the --classnames, --suites, or --tests parameters. Alternatively, use the --testlevel parameter to run all the tests in your org, local tests, or specified tests.
To see code coverage results, use the --codecoverage parameter with --resultformat. The output displays a high-level summary of the test run and the code coverage values for classes in your org. If you specify human-readable result format, use the --detailedcoverage parameter to see detailed coverage results for each test method run.

NOTE: The testRunCoverage value (JSON and JUnit result formats) is a percentage of the covered lines and total lines from all the Apex classes evaluated by the tests in this run.

loglevel.longDescription: Permissible values are: trace, debug, info, warn, error, fatal, TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL

apiversion.longDescription: Override the API version used for API requests made by this command.

RunAllTestsInOrg—All tests are in your org and in installed managed packages are run
